Ridge High School’s Max Mahoney made a big decision about his future on Wednesday, and that’s where the Red Devils’ senior will be attending college next year. 
Mahoney chose Boston University as his next stop, choosing coach Joe Jones and the Terriers over Yale, Princeton and Stony Brook. 
“It was their commitment to me, they’ve been recruiting me since the beginning,” Mahoney said. “The staff had been great when I took my official visit and I had a good feel for the guys on the team and the coaching staff was really supportive, the city is great and the school is good academically so it all played a part.” 
Mahoney, a Courier News All-Area First Teamer last year, averaged 18.5 points and eight rebounds as Ridge finished as Skyland Conference Delaware Division co-champions, Somerset County Tournament finalists and North 2 Group IV finalists. In the group final, a 55-44 loss to Linden, Mahoney scored 16 points and pulled down six rebounds. 
“It’s a great fit for him academically and athletically,” Ridge coach Brian Feath said. “I’m real happy for him.” 
With his college decision made, Mahoney can now focus on his senior year and getting back to business with his teammates. 
“It’s definitely a weight off my shoulders, it’s been such a long process, especially over the summer and getting it over with I definitely feel I made the right decision and it’s great,” he said. “Now I can just focus on the high school season.” 
Mahoney will be a strong addition to a Boston University team that finished 24-11 last season, 15-3 in the Patriot League, advanced to the Patriot League Tournament final and fell in the first round of the NIT to Illinois. 
“They were so welcoming and how they treated me once I was on campus I felt they were commited to me,” Mahoney said of the Terriers’ staff. “They came to the high school three times to see me play ... that meant a lot to me.”
